lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Steven Manning (''Classrooms for Sale,'' Op-Ed, March 24) did not mention that according to a spokesman for the California Department of Education, a math textbook published by McGraw-Hill Inc. that is riddled with brand names might not have been scrutinized because the company originally offered the book free to the state (front page, March 21). Can't California afford to buy textbooks?
abstract: Phyllis Guest letter wonders if math textbook riddled with brand names was not closely scrutinized because McGraw-Hill originally offered it free to state of California; asks why California cannot afford to buy textbooks

headline.main: Mixing Algebra and Advertising; Free Texts at a Price
